results.title: Platoon
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Arnold Kopelson and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Oliver Stone’s breakthrough as a director, and based on his first-hand experience, “Platoon” is a brutally realistic look at a young soldier’s tour of duty in Vietnam. Chris Taylor is a college student who quits school to volunteer for the Army. After a few weeks at war however, he begins to see the naivete of his views of the war. He quickly discovers that he must do battle with not only the Viet Cong, but also the gnawing fear, physical exhaustion and the intense anger growing within him. Cast includes: Charlie Sheen, Willem Dafoe, Tom Berenger, Forest Whitaker and John McGinley.

results.title: Platinum
results.brief_description: Presents the history of platinum; examines its chemical properties such as stability and catalysis; and shows how it is processed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Platform = Zhan tai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: T-Mark, Artcam International, Hu Tong Communications, Li Kit Ming, Shozo Ichiyama and Jia Zhang-ke
results.brief_description: An insightful realistic portrayal of China in the 1980s beautifully presented by acclaimed Chinese director Jia Zhang-ke and supported by an equally superb cast in Wang Hong-wei (Minliang), Liang Jing-dong (Chang Jun), Yang Tian-yi (Zhong Pin) and Zhao Tao (Ruijuan). “Platform” is set in a time of tremendous political and socioeconomic change where pervasive western capitalist influences are beginning to impact on all aspects of Chinese life, family and values. Change is inevitable, even in the small rural town of Fenyang in Shanxi Province where the Fenyang Peasant Culture Group, a local performing arts troupe made up of teenagers face the choice of either maintaining their communal ways and propaganda performances or move into the new world of privatisation and pop culture. The story follows the paths of four young performers in this troupe, over a period of ten years from 1979 to 1989, exploring their friendships and relationships with each other, with family and with the rapidly changing political and social environment around them as they struggle, individually, and as part of the Culture Group, for identity. It is in this arena of identity that music plays such a crucial role. Laconic and slow-moving, sparse in narrative and set against a somewhat bleak background where the characters often appear aloof and distant, “Platform” manages to draw the audience in, aided not only by the rare inside look at Chinese history during a turbulent time, but also by some powerful and evocative sounds and images shot by innovative cinematographer Yu Lik Wai. (Awards: Venice; Buenos Aires; Singapore)

results.title: Plastics into the future
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Bruce Shearer and Shane Mulcahy
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman discusses with Bob Leschen of the Plastics Institute of Australia about the definition, application, types, manufacture and acceptance of plastics in everyday use.

results.title: Plastics and fibreglass: thermoplastics
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Helmut Engelhardt
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of the strip heater for bending acrylic sheet. The actions cover various machine tools for cutting plastic sheet, the making of jigs, cutting, planing, filing, buffing and polishing operations. Cementing pieces together. Techniques are then applied to making a project.

results.title: Plastics
results.creator_credit: Holt, King Screen Films, Marilyn Sanders and Terry Sanders
results.brief_description: Looks at plastics being moulded in the factory into a variety of products highlighting the versatility of this product and its importance in our daily lives. Non-narrated using creative and evocative music and sounds. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Plasticity in the Central Nervous System (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows three contemporary research approaches to neuronal plasticity in the adult. Approach one is the investigation of naturally regrowing neuronal tissue in the olfactory system. Approach two is nerve recovery after experimental lesioning, and approach three is the long term potentiation of neuronal stimulation

results.title: Plastic art
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A sculptor creates a bronze statuary group on the theme: “Man’s confidence in his fellow-man”. We see the preliminary sketch, the wire skeleton on which the rough figures are built up as the sculptor observes living models, the measurements of the clay group being taken, and the casting of the life-size bronze replica.
